Submodules

geodesicparams.ellipsefitting.matrix_functions module

Functions for performing element-wise operations on matrices.

These operations include element-wise exponentiation, multiplication, and division.

geodesicparams.ellipsefitting.matrix_functions.element_div(mat1, mat2)[source]

Compute the element-wise division of the matrix <mat1> by the matrix <mat2>.

Specifically, the result[i, j] = mat1[i, j] / mat2[i, j].

Parameters:

  • mat1 (matrix) – An mpmath matrix with each element serving as the dividend.

  • mat2 (matrix) – An mpmath matrix with each element serving as the divisor.

Returns:

result – An mpmath matrix containing the result of the element-wise division of <mat1> by <mat2>.

Return type:

matrix

geodesicparams.ellipsefitting.matrix_functions.element_mul(mat1, mat2)[source]

Compute the element-wise multiplication of the matrix <mat1> and the matrix <mat2>.

Specifically, the result[i, j] = mat1[i, j] * mat2[i, j].

Parameters:

  • mat1 (matrix) – An mpmath matrix.

  • mat2 (matrix) – An mpmath matrix.

Returns:

result – An mpmath matrix containing the result of the element-wise multiplication of <mat1> and <mat2>.

Return type:

matrix

geodesicparams.ellipsefitting.matrix_functions.element_pow(mat1, mat2)[source]

Compute the element-wise exponentiation of the matrix <mat1> to the matrix <mat2> powers.

Specifically, the result[i, j] = mat1[i, j] ** mat2[i, j]. <mat2> can be an integer; in this case, the elements of mat1 will each be raised to the <mat2> power.

Parameters:

  • mat1 (matrix) – An mpmath matrix with each element serving as the bases to exponentiated by <mat2>.

  • mat2 (matrix, integer) – An mpmath matrix or an integer. If a matrix is used, the elements of <mat1> are raised to the power of each element in <mat2>.

Returns:

result – An mpmath matrix containing the result of the element-wise exponentiation of <mat1> and <mat2>.

Return type:

matrix
